org.apache.ambari.server.serveraction

Class AbstractServerAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.serveraction.AbstractServerAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerAction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractUpgradeServerAction, KerberosServerAction, PostUserCreationHookServerAction, UpdateKerberosConfigsServerAction

    public abstract class AbstractServerAction
extends Object
implements ServerAction
    AbstractServerAction is an abstract implementation of a ServerAction.

    This abstract implementation provides common facilities for all ServerActions, such as maintaining the ExecutionCommand and HostRoleCommand properties. It also provides a convenient way to generate CommandReports for reporting status.

      • createCompletedCommandReport

        protected CommandReport createCompletedCommandReport()
        Returns:
        a command report with 0 exit code and COMPLETED HostRoleStatus

      • createCommandReport

        protected CommandReport createCommandReport(int exitCode,
                                            HostRoleStatus status,
                                            String structuredOut,
                                            String stdout,
                                            String stderr)
        Creates a CommandReport used to report back to Ambari the status of this ServerAction.
        Parameters:
        exitCode - an integer value declaring the exit code for this action - 0 typically indicates success.
        status - a HostRoleStatus indicating the status of this action
        structuredOut - a String containing the (typically) JSON-formatted data representing the output from this action (this data is stored in the database, along with the command status)
        stdout - A string containing the data from the standard out stream (this data is stored in the database, along with the command status)
        stderr - A string containing the data from the standard error stream (this data is stored in the database, along with the command status)
        Returns:
        the generated CommandReport, or null if the HostRoleCommand or ExecutionCommand properties are missing

      • getCommandParameters

        protected Map<String,String> getCommandParameters()
        Returns the command parameters value from the ExecutionCommand

        The returned map should be assumed to be read-only.

        Returns:
        the (assumed read-only) command parameters value from the ExecutionCommand

      • getCommandParameterValue

        protected String getCommandParameterValue(String propertyName)
        Attempts to safely retrieve a property with the specified name from the this action's relevant command parameters Map.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - a String declaring the name of the item from commandParameters to retrieve
        Returns:
        the value of the requested property, or null if not found or set
